intro.description: In a few steps, this cheat sheet will show you how to create and export a TestSpecification.

item.title: Create your own TestSpecification
item.description: First, go with the mouse cursor in the "GlobalTester Navigator" window. Right-click, and choose "New -> Project...". In the "New Project" wizard, select "GlobalTester -> TestSpecification", and click "Next >". Enter a name for your TestSpecification Project in the text field "Project name". Then click "Finish"

item.title: Add a TestCase
item.description:
In the "GlobalTester Navigator" window, your own TestSpecification will be shown as a project folder. In its sub-folder TestCases, you can now add a default TestCase that will select the master file:
Go with the mouse cursor in the "GlobalTester Navigator" window and choose the "TestCases" folder. Right-click, and choose "New -> Other...".
In the "New" wizard, select "GlobalTester -> TestCase", and click "Next >". Enter a name for your TestCase in the text field "File name". Then click "Finish"

item.title: Export your TestSpecification
item.description:
Go with the mouse cursor in the "GlobalTester Navigator" window. Right-click, and choose "Export". In the tree view, select "GlobalTester > Export TestSpecification to OpenDocument Format". Click the "Next" button.
In the TestSpecification Export Wizard, select the TestSpecification you want to export, its layout, and the destination. Then click "Finish".
